Redskins fan here, this is absolutely true. He's without a doubt our number one target, but odds are he'll get hurt again so be wary. I think his ADP should be a little lower, but he's a top talent. If he goes down with an injury though we also have Niles Paul who is a very similar player (converted to TE, was a WR) and he'll probably get a decent amount of targets if Reed were to go down.
You aren't really strengthening anything in your team by doing this. I say no.

No, its not similar to when Ramsey went on loan. Aaron was 20 when he went on loan, Wilshere is 24. Aaron hadn't had the chance to truly secure a starting position in the first team, Wilshere has been given that chance and hasn't been able to capitalize on it.

No way, Xhaka is a DM. Santi is much more attacking than Xhaka is. Xhaka is like Coq but with the passing skills of Santi. Until either Jack or Ramsey figure out how to pass like Santi then we don't really have a replacement for him.

Agreed. Ospina is much better than we give him credit for, he just needs to learn how to catch the ball sometimes instead of always parrying.
Well obviously he's not the same Santi he was two years ago, but he's vital to our squad. Jack is erratic, Santi knows how to keep possession and pick out passes.

Ramsey is overrated. Now before you get upset, I'm not saying he's bad, but I just think he's overrated. Doesn't know how to place his shot somewhere other than right at the keeper and loses possession a lot. I love his work rate and I think he's definitely a good player, just overrated by Arsenal fans.
Still somewhat young and is also English, we could get good money for him next summer if he doesn't pick up another long term injury. I don't think he's content with sitting on the bench either.

D-Line is the biggest question mark, as well as our safeties. We don't have a whole lot of depth on the line, and the loss of Pot Roast is going to be difficult to deal with. We have an ever aging DeAngelo Hall playing safety and there are more question marks as to who will start as our other one.

I think he's going to get destroyed first game by Brown, and the media will flip shit. "What a waste of money, looks like the Redskins get another free agent bust" and stuff like that. But after the first game he's going to be solid.

Redskins fan here, We're going to be throwing the ball a lot this year, I mean look at our running backs. We have one of the best TE's in the league, a down field threat (Jackson), and a big possession receiver (Garcon). Our defense isn't great this season, however they'll be decent enough to get a stop often enough. Our games will likely be shootouts so I would definitely consider picking him. He can put up big numbers with the passing game we have.
Perez will get a run of games in February when Giroud cools off. I'd imagine this is what we'll look like, injuries permitting.

Every time one of us tries a shot from outside the box they close it down, don't know why we aren't doing the same. I think that's why Wenger doesn't really like long range shots, because they just end up getting blocked.

A few points
-I just think it's crazy how much Ozil changes the game when he's in. We play so much better with him.
-Xhaka is vital for our team. Those long balls are insane. The only way he can play effectively is with someone that plays more attacking than him (Ramsey, Cazorla, Wilshere). Coq should only serve as a backup to him in my opinion.
-Although Holding made a few mistakes, I thought he played well. His passing is pretty good and he seems very composed on the ball. That corner where him and Bellerin went for the same ball and flicked it on to Ighalo was atrocious, but I thought he seemed very mature for his age.
-Walcott was great yesterday. Quiet, but great. That cross to Alexis was fantastic and he did a great job using the space he was given. Him and Bellerin are our best combo on the right.
-Alexis drifts over to the left when he plays striker a lot, he was basically playing Ox's position. Ox was kind of obsolete this whole game, plus he was not tracking back at all. Not sure where he'll fit into the team.

Yes I loved how much he was tracking back, he was helping out Hector so much. Ox on the other hand didn't track back at all leaving Monreal to take on Amrabat alone. And since Amrabat is much faster than Monreal, so many chances were created from that wing.
Wenger said another signing isn't likely in the last press conference, so I'm assuming he's done. If anything maybe a fullback, but we have good depth everywhere else.
He speaks Spanish as well from his time at Villarreal.

Been listening to some of his older stuff lately, never really appreciated how good of a lyricist he was with double entendres and such, hoping he can replicate that with some kind of project in the future.
Xhaka's passing

What I'd like to happen: We win the group easily and draw Benfica in the round of 16. We beat them 4-1 on aggregate and then draw City, and absolutely smash them. Then we draw Bayern and get two massive away goals, but we lose the away fixture 2-3. We play a tough home match and Giroud scores a late header to put us through. Then we get Barcelona in the final and we win 3-0 through an Oli G hattrick with Mesut assisting all goals.
What will actually happen: We'll lose both games to PSG and it will come down to the last fixture against Basel, where we will scrape out a 2-1 victory to place second. We draw Juve in the round of 16 and lose the home fixture 1-3 but win away 2-0, however Juve go through on away goals.
Xhaka, Cazorla, and Ozil. I am so ready
